lead_paragraph: The halt by Russian and Syrian forces is a prelude to an eight-hour “humanitarian pause” that is scheduled to start on Thursday.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

headline.print_headline: A Break From Airstrikes on Rebel-Held Aleppo
headline.main: Rebel-Held Areas of Aleppo Get a Break From Aerial Attacks

snippet: The halt by Russian and Syrian forces is a prelude to an eight-hour “humanitarian pause” that is scheduled to start on Thursday....
abstract: Russian and Syrian governments halt airstrikes on rebel-held districts of Aleppo in what Russia calls gesture of good will ahead of eight-hour ceasefire to allow in humanitarian aid; humanitarian groups and citizens express distrust of Russia's motives.
